unnormalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural India**
normalised: environmental news: renewable energy boost for rural india

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26 - A groundbreaking initiative is set to transform rural electrification in Rajasthan, focusing on harnessing renewable energy sources. Dr. Sharma, a leading environmental scientist at IIT-Bombay, highlighted the potential of solar and wind power in providing sustainable energy solutions.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty six - a groundbreaking initiative is set to transform rural electrification in rajasthan, focusing on harnessing renewable energy sources. doctor sharma, a leading environmental scientist at I I T-bombay, highlighted the potential of solar and wind power in providing sustainable energy solutions.

unnormalised: The project, spearheaded by the Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation Limited (RRECL), aims to establish mini-grid power plants in remote villages, reducing dependence on conventional fossil fuels. These plants will utilize photovoltaic panels covering thousands of sq ft and small-scale wind turbines.
normalised: the project, spearheaded by the rajasthan renewable energy corporation limited (R R E C L), aims to establish mini-grid power plants in remote villages, reducing dependence on conventional fossil fuels. these plants will utilize photovoltaic panels covering thousands of square feet and small-scale wind turbines.

unnormalised: The initiative includes community awareness programs, educating villagers about the benefits of clean energy. Each family will receive a subsidized connection, costing approximately Rs. 5000, with monthly tariffs based on usage. The project also aims to create local employment, training villagers in the maintenance and repair of the renewable energy infrastructure. This endeavour promises a brighter and greener future, powered by the sun and wind, across the vast landscapes of Rajasthan. The estimated coverage area of initial solar installations is ~2000 sq ft per village.
normalised: the initiative includes community awareness programs, educating villagers about the benefits of clean energy. each family will receive a subsidized connection, costing approximately rupees five thousand, with monthly tariffs based on usage. the project also aims to create local employment, training villagers in the maintenance and repair of the renewable energy infrastructure. this endeavour promises a brighter and greener future, powered by the sun and wind, across the vast landscapes of rajasthan. the estimated coverage area of initial solar installations is approximately two thousand square feet per village.
